bibl.title: Despatch from Francisco Joaquim Ferra do Amaral to United States Vice Consul
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: have of the existence of goods in the hands of the inland trader.

The experienced opinion of Silva Portó is that what has now occurred to the American Mission he had long thought one day would happen as he well knows the character of the Bailundos, not being able to state if the affair really occurred as the missionaries state or even if any Portuguese merchants directly or indirectly took part. The comportment of this illustrous Portuguese settler to the English Missionary whose letter you enclose in one of your despatches to which I reply wakes his statement altogether beyond questioning as he offered him his house in Bihé to stop as long as he pleased so long as he only preached the gospel and did not enter into policies, for from the moment he did he would have to leave the house in order not to compromise Silva Porto with the natives.
Not less is the complaint of the Sobba against the American Missionaries concerning their
